body.description: Weymic Wm58 Classic Style Dynamic Vocal Audio Instrument Microphone with Clean Sound,Metal Body Professional Microphone (not Include Cable)Weymic New Wm58 Mic Dynamic Vocal Mic classic Style Microphone Audio Instrument Mic The WM58 Professional Microphones were designed to sound just like the standard in the industry. Parameter: Impedance: 600 ohms±30% Sensitivity: -52±1dB Frequency Response: 45 Hz - 16,000 Hz Pattern:Uni-Directional without logo The WM58 is a professional moving coil dynamic handheld microphone. it makes your voice sound great. The durable zinc alloy metal construction means this mic is great for everyday use. Sounds great in the studio or on the stage. Perfect for On-Stage or Studio Use This microphone gives you a robust sound with high gain before feedback thanks to its moving-coil dynamic element. It’s also uni-directional so your microphone only picks up sounds that are directly in front it – that way your audio is reproduced without interference from instruments or speakers on stage. XLR Input for Professional Quality Sound The WM58 features an XLR input, giving you the highest quality sound possible out of your vocal performances. Box Contains 1 x Microphone Note: No any cable Included, this mic need a cable to connect EQ or other music device,and pls provided by yourself 3-pin XLR male to XLR female or 6.5mm to XLR female, depend on your music device. if you need cable ,plese found the product below https://www.amazon.com/dp/B093GB226C

reviews.reviewerName: String Theory Studios LLCString Theory Studios LLC
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Mic was less than 20$ and sounds great. It says SM58 on there which is perculiar considering it is a mimic. Is there some kind of counterfeit thing going o here I am unsure, but the mic rivals the SM58 in quality and has exceptional sound.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars how are these so good?
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I am using these as drum mics and honestly they sound better than any other mic I've tried to date. I know that sounds crazy, but just watch the video. They sound absolutely killer, full, nice frequency response, clean signal path, solid construction, and dirt cheap. I'm using them on everything here except the overheads. Mind blown.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I'm a believer now.
reviews.reviewText: Okay...I HAD to try it. I have a thing about finding diamonds in the rough. This little mic qualifies. I have some very well-respected mainstream microphones...and really don't need any more. That said, I had to try the Behringer 8500...yup, it was legit. Now the Behringer "upgrade" SM-85a, by contrast, was a disappointment...the 8500 sounded better to my ears and had far less handling noise. CAD mics are also an incredible value in a microphone.That brings me to the Weymic WM58...very, very close to the Behringer 8500...for eleven bucks less! (okay, I did sorta admit that I look for low-hanging fruit) The sound is very well-balanced, with maybe a little hot spot in the midrange, but, despite some comments to the contrary, I did notice a proximity effect, which I appreciate in fattening up a vocal. Construction is solid. I see a lot of situations where an individual probably doesn't need to spend any more money to have a good-sounding working microphone.Well done, Weymic!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good purchase... exceeded expectations!
reviews.reviewText: This is simply a good microphone... compared to my trusty sm58 I feel it stacks up well for the price.I don't think I would trust having this be a road or gig mic...it's seems like it's built well, but I still acknowledge that for under 20 bucks, quality will have to suffer somewhere, but I have a couple set up in our practice space, where they will stay in the stand forever. I play guitar and sing, so I also will not be walking around or manhandling the unit...I'm impressed...it was worth the purchase so far...but you always get what you pay for in the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Pros: light, easy to connectCons: not good with sound, lots of echoOverall: mmm… not so good

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great mic ! Listen to my Video in regards to the sound this mic can produce
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. The microphone that I got, the wires were "not" un-soldered. I was careful check inside and I'm not sure why people would go in there in the first place, but again the wires in mine was OK.I write and record commercially licensed music under performance rights organization BMI, Inc as a songwriter/composer. Listen to my short instrument called "There is a light" that I attached to this review. This is from the microphone and there is hardly no other effects that I used except for post reverb. The recording applications that I am using the microphone for is to record direct baritone ukulele and also guitarlele (gutalele/guilele) which is not hooked up to any amplifier. I am using the xlr input jack on my USB audio interface that does have a mic' pre-amp. This microphnoe is so good as an alternative to the SM57, that I'm actually using it for many instrumental tracks like the one that I have in this review... It's that good of a microphone.You'll see a lot of guys stating that this microphone has a bit of a mid scoop in regards to the frequencies which is GOOD because many acoustic stringed instruments you want to have that in regards to pre or post EQ anyways. The other thing to note, is the reason why I use a dynamic microphone like this, is not just the over all cost.. It's because large or small diaphragm condenser microphone can pickup A LOT of outside noise. This microphone does not pick up any outside noise. Also, there is not a lot of noise floor / self-noise if you keep the gain down low, and then use normalization to boot the db's of the track in question. - Tom

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023

reviews.reviewText: I was amazed of the quality of this mic . And output is very good. It maynot be a 57 but it sounds and looks like one . .Super sound and a super deal. .You won't go wrong .Cheers

reviews.reviewText: It's an ok product but there's no way to turn off and on. Quite a flaw.
The media could not be loaded. bought 6 wm57 to mic all drums and it sounded really good. A bit of eq and compression in the mix made it way better.

Es un micrófono 🎤 Muy bien hecho y Muy funcional, no es el mítico original de otra marca reconocida icónica pero éste micrófono está a la altura del mítico, éste micrófono está Muy bien hecho y me sirvió mucho para micrófonear mi amplificador de guitarra electrica las frecuencias se captaron todas muy clara excelente micrófono 🎤

The sound quality on this is amazing, I plugged it into my Focusrite red box did a mic check everything sounded fine studio quality definitely not a toy or a cheap imitation - it works.I ordered the plain mic without the cord as I have a couple new XLR cords already and did not need another. I was looking for a secondary hand held vocal mic as I realized I screwed up some recordings holding a sensitive condenser mic for a vocal. I did get a proper arm and pop screen for the condenser mics and they work great but I thought I should get a handheld XLR mic for certain vocal situations.I say it's a great secondary vocal mic just because most producers use condensers on vocals but you could easily record studio quality vocals with this mic. I don't have a professional studio where may need I to mpress clients with expensive brand name gear - I just care if it works. This mic works as advertised looks and feels like the famous counterpart.

The media could not be loaded. Ha un boost sulle alte in particolare sulle 2/3k. Devo dire che per il prezzo ha un'ottima definizione! Raga con 15 euro vi portate a casa un ottimo mic per varie occasioni, l'ho preso per scherzo e per ora l'ho sostituito al mio Shure 😅
Son très correct pour le prix
